returns._0: The ENS node hash of the reverse record

params.addr: The address to claim the reverse record for

returns._0: The ENS node hash of the reverse record

params.owner: The address to set as the owner of the reverse record
params.resolver: The resolver of the reverse node

returns._0: The ENS node hash of the reverse record

params.ensAddr: The address of the ENS registry

params.addr: The address to get the reverse node hash for

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params.name: The name to set for the calling account

returns._0: The ENS node hash of the reverse record

params.name: The name to set for the provided address
params.owner: The owner of the reverse node
params.resolver: The resolver of the reverse node

returns._0: The ENS node hash of the reverse record

params.name: The name to set for the provided address
params.owner: The owner of the reverse node
params.resolver: The resolver of the reverse node
params.signature: The signature to authorise the claim

returns._0: The ENS node hash of the reverse record

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

ResolverAddressZero().notice: Thrown when the resolver address is zero

SignatureExpiryTooHigh().notice: The signature expiry is too high

Unauthorised().notice: Thrown when the caller is not authorised to perform the action

DefaultResolverChanged(address).notice: Emitted when the default resolver is changed.

ReverseClaimed(address,bytes32).notice: Emitted when a reverse record is claimed.

claim(address).notice: Transfers ownership of the reverse ENS record associated with the         calling account.

claimForAddr(address,address,address).notice: Transfers ownership of the reverse ENS record associated with the         addr provided account.

claimForAddrWithSignature(address,addres.notice: Transfers ownership of the reverse ENS record associated with the         addr provided account using a signature to authorise.

claimWithResolver(address,address).notice: Transfers ownership of the reverse ENS record associated with the         calling account.

constructor.notice: Sets the ENS registry and claims `addr.reverse`

node(address).notice: Returns the ENS node hash for the reverse record associated with         the addr provided account.

setName(string).notice: Sets the `name()` record for the reverse ENS record associated         with the calling account, and updates the resolver to the         default reverse resolver.

setNameForAddr(address,address,address,s.notice: Sets the `name()` record for the reverse ENS record associated         with the addr provided account, and updates the resolver to the         resolver provided.

setNameForAddrWithSignature(address,addr.notice: Sets the `name()` record for the reverse ENS record associated         with the addr provided account using a signature to authorise,         and updates the resolver to the resolver provided.

userdoc.notice: The registrar for reverse records on ENS
